title: Zero Hour for the Middle East
summary: After more than a decade of wars, from Syria to Gaza, the Middle East is exhausted by conflict. Is it ready to find another way?

title: Zelensky to Meet With Trump at Mar-a-Lago About Plan to End War With Russia
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine brings a revised 20-point peace proposal, as well as doubts about whether Russia is serious about pursuing peace.

title: What America Might Look Like With Zero Immigration
summary: The Trump administration’s efforts to reduce the foreign-born population are being felt in hospitals and soccer leagues and on Main Streets across the country, with hints of what’s to come.

title: From A.I. to Chips, Big Tech Is Getting What It Wants From Trump
summary: The president has backed policies that allow the industry to grow unfettered. The mutually beneficial alliance is causing concern among some conservatives.

title: How Oil, Drugs and Immigration Fueled Trump’s Venezuela Campaign
summary: New details of deliberations show how aides with overlapping agendas drove the United States toward a militarized confrontation with Venezuela.

title: Trump Pursues His Legacy One Name at a Time
summary: In attaching his name to buildings and programs while still president, Donald Trump is walking a path paved by conquerors and autocrats.

title: Brigitte Bardot, French Movie Icon Who Renounced Stardom, Dies at 91
summary: “And God Created Woman” made her a world-famous sex symbol in the 1950s. She later gave up acting to devote her life to animal welfare.

title: From Sex Appeal to the Far Right, Brigitte Bardot Symbolized a Changing France
summary: In the decades after becoming a megastar, the French actress became as known for her politics as she once had been for her acting career.

title: New College of Florida Was Progressive. Then Gov. DeSantis Overhauled It.
summary: At the state school, gender studies is out. ‘The Odyssey’ is required reading. A Charlie Kirk statue  is coming. Has one ideological bubble replaced another?

title: The Double Life of Thomas Goldstein, a Supreme Court Lawyer
summary: Thomas Goldstein was a superstar in the legal world. He was also a secret high-stakes gambler, whose wild 10-year run may now land him in prison.

title: Opinionated Lists for an Overwhelming Year
summary: As the year drew to a close, we reached out to Opinion columnists and contributors for personal lists.

title: Forget Willpower. If You Want to Resist Temptation, You’ll Need Something Else.
summary: Rather than try to resist temptation in the moment, many successful people arrange their lives to minimize the need for willpower in the first place.

title: To See Mamdani Sworn In, Some Out-of-Towners Confront N.Y.C. Prices
summary: Zohran Mamdani campaigned for mayor on a platform of taming the high cost of living for New Yorkers. Visitors will get a crash course in the affordability crisis.

title: Families Demand Answers a Year After Deadliest Plane Crash in South Korea
summary: Many details of the Jeju Air disaster that killed 179 people remain unclear despite multiple investigations by officials and protests by the victims’ families.

title: In Myanmar’s Election, ‘Voting Out of Fear, Not Hope’
summary: The voting for Parliament is almost sure to favor the ruling military junta, which is stage-managing the polls. Still, some see them as the most pragmatic way to try to improve conditions.

title: Ski Slopes Are Empty as a Labor Dispute Shuts Down Telluride, Colo.
summary: Now, vacationers looking to ski are wondering what to do and merchants are hoping it doesn’t last.
